match.title: 1st ODI

image.caption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium
image.longCaption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium, Mirpur, October 15, 2009

match.hoursInfo: 13.00 start, First Session 13.00-16.30, Interval 16.30-17.15, Second Session 17.15-20.45

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim run out (Cremer) 107 (109b 9x4 1x6 171m) SR: 98.16

dismissalComment.html: Another direct hit, another wicket for Zimbabwe. Mushfiq is way short of the crease. Banged in, Mashrafe rises with it as he directs it to backward point and sets off for a single. Cremer is in business again. So, it takes a pin-point direct hit to end Mushfiq's superbly-controlled knock

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman run out (Cremer) 57 (58b 4x4 2x6 88m) SR: 98.27

dismissalComment.html: Cremer lasers a direct hit and sends back Sabbir for 57. Panyangara nearly nails the yorker length as Mushfiq jabs it away towards backward point. Sabbir responds but is not quick enough. Cremer had only one stump to aim but hit the bullseye

Nasir dances out and goes through with his attempted hook though his balance was foiled with the shortening of the length. Holes out to deep backward square leg and becomes the second Bangladesh batsman to bag a duck this innings, after Liton

four, six, and out! Muzarabani turns to the slower ball and removes Mashrafe. The Bangladesh captain has done his job, though, injecting late impetus, despite the loss of three wickets in a space of six balls. This was a touch full on off, Mashrafe loads up but can't generate enough power. Long-on snags the catch
Tamim has been undone by the slowness of the pitch. He attempts to launch it down the ground but ends up playing a one-handed mis-hit, which settles into the hands of Jongwe at long-on

Mutumbami takes the bails off. A crude heave and a miss from Shakib. Raza's footing is fine. He gives this loads of air outside off, luring Shakib out of the crease. Shakib can't connect and Bangladesh have been set back further

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Litton Das c Cremer b Jongwe 0 (6b 0x4 0x6 8m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Jongwe strikes. Good length and outside off, Liton inches half forward as he aims to drive. He can only slice it to backward point, where Cremer takes a good overhead catch. Litton gone for a six-ball duck

dismissalText.commentary: Mahmudullah b Panyangara 9 (20b 1x4 0x6 27m) SR: 45

dismissalComment.html: Panyangara nips out Mahmudullah with an inducker. Back of a length and cuts back in off the seam, shoots through the gate and hits middle. Mahmudullah was crease-bound and paid the penalty

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Jongwe b Sikandar Raza 40 (68b 3x4 2x6 96m) SR: 58.82

dismissalComment.html: Tamim has been undone by the slowness of the pitch. He attempts to launch it down the ground but ends up playing a one-handed mis-hit, which settles into the hands of Jongwe at long-on

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan st Mutumbami b Sikandar Raza 16 (21b 2x4 0x6 17m) SR: 76.19

dismissalComment.html: Mutumbami takes the bails off. A crude heave and a miss from Shakib. Raza's footing is fine. He gives this loads of air outside off, luring Shakib out of the crease. Shakib can't connect and Bangladesh have been set back further

dismissalText.commentary: Sabbir Rahman run out (Cremer) 57 (58b 4x4 2x6 88m) SR: 98.27

dismissalComment.html: Cremer lasers a direct hit and sends back Sabbir for 57. Panyangara nearly nails the yorker length as Mushfiq jabs it away towards backward point. Sabbir responds but is not quick enough. Cremer had only one stump to aim but hit the bullseye

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain c Chibhabha b Muzarabani 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Nasir dances out and goes through with his attempted hook though his balance was foiled with the shortening of the length. Holes out to deep backward square leg and becomes the second Bangladesh batsman to bag a duck this innings, after Liton

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim run out (Cremer) 107 (109b 9x4 1x6 171m) SR: 98.16

dismissalComment.html: Another direct hit, another wicket for Zimbabwe. Mushfiq is way short of the crease. Banged in, Mashrafe rises with it as he directs it to backward point and sets off for a single. Cremer is in business again. So, it takes a pin-point direct hit to end Mushfiq's superbly-controlled knock

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Mashrafe Mortaza c Jongwe b Muzarabani 14 (8b 1x4 1x6 12m) SR: 175

dismissalComment.html: four, six, and out! Muzarabani turns to the slower ball and removes Mashrafe. The Bangladesh captain has done his job, though, injecting late impetus, despite the loss of three wickets in a space of six balls. This was a touch full on off, Mashrafe loads up but can't generate enough power. Long-on snags the catch

dismissalText.commentary: Arafat Sunny run out (Williams/Waller) 15 (8b 3x4 0x6 13m) SR: 187.5

dismissalComment.html: nice and full on middle, hacked down to long-on. They push for two but Sunny is caught short on the second run as Waller runs in, collects the ball, and disturbs the furniture

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura lbw b Nasir Hossain 41 (51b 0x4 2x6 97m) SR: 80.39

dismissalComment.html: Nasir has his hands aloft in joy; Bangladesh open the series with a crushing win. Chigumbura is the last man out. Mutumbami out with an injured ankle and will not come out to bat. Flattish and pushed through to ping the pad in front of middle and leg

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Al-Amin Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Luke Jongwe c Mushfiqur Rahim b Al-Amin Hossain 39 (51b 4x4 1x6 63m) SR: 76.47

dismissalComment.html: Two wickets in two overs for Bangladesh. Wide line outside off, Jongwe ill-advisedly chases it with a cut and nicks off with Mushfiq snapping a low catch and the drink would taste doubly sweet for the hosts

Excellent catch from Liton. Long-off and Long-on nearly collided but Liton hangs on. Shakib gives this ample air on middle, Chamu has a crack at it, but does not middle the lofted strike. Liton shows good judgement and pouches it at long-off
Shakib strikes again. Ervine skips out, but does not meet the pitch. Instead of lofting it away, he scoops it feebly to Nasir at mid-off
bowled'em. Timbahh! Pushed through fairly quickly, keeps low as well to undo Williams. He makes room, exposes all three stumps but misses the cut. Shakib hits and celebrates with Mirpur
Shakib brings out the arm-ball, which snakes in with the angle and raps Cremer on the pad in line with middle and off. The forefinger goes up..
Maiden five-wicket haul in ODIs for Shakib. Tossed up full, Panyangara wants to swipe across the line but misses as Shakib rattles the stumps

belated appeal for caught behind and given! 200th ODI wicket for Mashrafe. Zimbabwe have lost half their side and Mutumbami is nursing an injured ankle. Raza uses his feet, Mashrafe is wary of it as he shortens his length. The batsman swings and edges it behind
short and wide outside off, Waller goes for a cut and ends up spooning it into the lap of Nasir at backward point. Mashrafe has his second scalp

headshotImage.caption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liton Das player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Litton Das b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Chamu Chibhabha c Litton Das b Shakib Al Hasan 9 (23b 1x4 0x6 39m) SR: 39.13

dismissalComment.html: Excellent catch from Liton. Long-off and Long-on nearly collided but Liton hangs on. Shakib gives this ample air on middle, Chamu has a crack at it, but does not middle the lofted strike. Liton shows good judgement and pouches it at long-off

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Craig Ervine c Nasir Hossain b Shakib Al Hasan 2 (13b 0x4 0x6 15m) SR: 15.38

dismissalComment.html: Shakib strikes again. Ervine skips out, but does not meet the pitch. Instead of lofting it away, he scoops it feebly to Nasir at mid-off

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Al-Amin Hossain
dismissalText.commentary: Luke Jongwe c Mushfiqur Rahim b Al-Amin Hossain 39 (51b 4x4 1x6 63m) SR: 76.47

dismissalComment.html: Two wickets in two overs for Bangladesh. Wide line outside off, Jongwe ill-advisedly chases it with a cut and nicks off with Mushfiq snapping a low catch and the drink would taste doubly sweet for the hosts

dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams b Shakib Al Hasan 8 (13b 1x4 0x6 21m) SR: 61.53

dismissalComment.html: bowled'em. Timbahh! Pushed through fairly quickly, keeps low as well to undo Williams. He makes room, exposes all three stumps but misses the cut. Shakib hits and celebrates with Mirpur

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza 3 (25b 0x4 0x6 26m) SR: 12

dismissalComment.html: belated appeal for caught behind and given! 200th ODI wicket for Mashrafe. Zimbabwe have lost half their side and Mutumbami is nursing an injured ankle. Raza uses his feet, Mashrafe is wary of it as he shortens his length. The batsman swings and edges it behind

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Malcolm Waller c Nasir Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza 1 (10b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 10

dismissalComment.html: short and wide outside off, Waller goes for a cut and ends up spooning it into the lap of Nasir at backward point. Mashrafe has his second scalp

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Cremer lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 15 (21b 2x4 0x6 31m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: Shakib brings out the arm-ball, which snakes in with the angle and raps Cremer on the pad in line with middle and off. The forefinger goes up..

dismissalText.commentary: Tinashe Panyangara b Shakib Al Hasan 5 (9b 1x4 0x6 7m) SR: 55.55

dismissalComment.html: Maiden five-wicket haul in ODIs for Shakib. Tossed up full, Panyangara wants to swipe across the line but misses as Shakib rattles the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura lbw b Nasir Hossain 41 (51b 0x4 2x6 97m) SR: 80.39

dismissalComment.html: Nasir has his hands aloft in joy; Bangladesh open the series with a crushing win. Chigumbura is the last man out. Mutumbami out with an injured ankle and will not come out to bat. Flattish and pushed through to ping the pad in front of middle and leg

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura lbw b Nasir Hossain 41 (51b 0x4 2x6 97m) SR: 80.39

commentTextItems.html: Nasir has his hands aloft in joy; Bangladesh open the series with a crushing win. Chigumbura is the last man out. Mutumbami out with an injured ankle and will not come out to bat. Flattish and pushed through to ping the pad in front of middle and leg

commentPostTextItems.html: 8:20pm: That is that. Many thanks for tuning in and do come back for the second ODI on Monday. Till then, cheerio.

Chigumbura: The way we played today we made a lot of mistakes and gave away boundaries towards the end. We then kept losing wickets. Obviously, lot of work needs to be done. It was a good decision to bowl first but we did not take the opportunity. We did not apply ourselves when we went out to bat. Other than Jongwe, we did not play ourselves in.

Mashrafe: I am still not 100% but I have worked hard. I am happy the team is winning and winning is a good habit. Mushfiq the run machine stepped up. I thought it was a good total and once again the bowling was brilliant with Shakib. He got his five wicket first time and I like to congratulate him and hopefully, we keep it going.
Mushfiqur, Man of the Match: We needed a big partnership. Credit goes to Tamim and Liton also chipped in. It made it easier for me. I scored in the practice match as well and I was confident.
8pm:The celebrations begin full swing in Mirpur with the fans waving the Bangladesh flag vigorously and dancing in the aisles. The hosts thump Zimbabwe by 145 runs.

Jonge ignited the chase of 274 with some adventurous hits. Enter Shakib. He showed subtle variations in flight and rattled Zimbabwe with his first five-for in ODIs. Mashrafe and Al-Amin proved able helping hands with the Bangladesh captain passing 200 ODI wickets. Chigumbura then lent some resistance before he was the last man dismissed. To add to Zimbabwe's woes, Mutumbami has ankle edema and needs seven days to recover.

Shakib: "I thought there was a little bit for spinners. I put the ball in the right areas and I was lucky. I believe in luck but I had to work hard. I know I had to contribute in two departments. Playing at home is a big advantage. We have showed our improvement to our world."
Moahammad Mahbu: "Congratulations to Bangladesh team & special thanks to hasan' musi & mash"
Hasan: "1st 5-wicket haul for Shakib in his ODI career!"

dismissalText.commentary: Tinashe Panyangara b Shakib Al Hasan 5 (9b 1x4 0x6 7m) SR: 55.55

commentTextItems.html: Maiden five-wicket haul in ODIs for Shakib. Tossed up full, Panyangara wants to swipe across the line but misses as Shakib rattles the stumps
dangled outside off, guided to point
Shakib gives this ample flight on off, driven to the covers
pushed to the left of the covers for one
down the pitch and quietly blocked to cover
turned off the pads through the same region
drifting into the pads, nudged through midwicket

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Cremer lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 15 (21b 2x4 0x6 31m) SR: 71.42

commentTextItems.html: Shakib brings out the arm-ball, which snakes in with the angle and raps Cremer on the pad in line with middle and off. The forefinger goes up..
Chigumbura steps down the pitch and drives this one to long-off
loads of air on off, scooped in front of point
angled into the pads from round the stumps, eased to long leg

dismissalText.commentary: Sean Williams b Shakib Al Hasan 8 (13b 1x4 0x6 21m) SR: 61.53

dismissalComment.html: bowled'em. Timbahh! Pushed through fairly quickly, keeps low as well to undo Williams. He makes room, exposes all three stumps but misses the cut. Shakib hits and celebrates with Mirpur

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura lbw b Nasir Hossain 41 (51b 0x4 2x6 97m) SR: 80.39

dismissalComment.html: Nasir has his hands aloft in joy; Bangladesh open the series with a crushing win. Chigumbura is the last man out. Mutumbami out with an injured ankle and will not come out to bat. Flattish and pushed through to ping the pad in front of middle and leg

dismissalText.long: c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza c Mushfiqur Rahim b Mashrafe Mortaza 3 (25b 0x4 0x6 26m) SR: 12

dismissalComment.html: belated appeal for caught behind and given! 200th ODI wicket for Mashrafe. Zimbabwe have lost half their side and Mutumbami is nursing an injured ankle. Raza uses his feet, Mashrafe is wary of it as he shortens his length. The batsman swings and edges it behind

dismissalText.long: c Nasir Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Malcolm Waller c Nasir Hossain b Mashrafe Mortaza 1 (10b 0x4 0x6 11m) SR: 10

dismissalComment.html: short and wide outside off, Waller goes for a cut and ends up spooning it into the lap of Nasir at backward point. Mashrafe has his second scalp

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Cremer lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 15 (21b 2x4 0x6 31m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: Shakib brings out the arm-ball, which snakes in with the angle and raps Cremer on the pad in line with middle and off. The forefinger goes up..

dismissalText.commentary: Tinashe Panyangara b Shakib Al Hasan 5 (9b 1x4 0x6 7m) SR: 55.55

dismissalComment.html: Maiden five-wicket haul in ODIs for Shakib. Tossed up full, Panyangara wants to swipe across the line but misses as Shakib rattles the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Taurai Muzarabani not out 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 1m) SR: 0
absent hurt

headshotImage.caption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mustafizur Rahman player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Excellent catch from Liton. Long-off and Long-on nearly collided but Liton hangs on. Shakib gives this ample air on middle, Chamu has a crack at it, but does not middle the lofted strike. Liton shows good judgement and pouches it at long-off
Shakib strikes again. Ervine skips out, but does not meet the pitch. Instead of lofting it away, he scoops it feebly to Nasir at mid-off
bowled'em. Timbahh! Pushed through fairly quickly, keeps low as well to undo Williams. He makes room, exposes all three stumps but misses the cut. Shakib hits and celebrates with Mirpur
Shakib brings out the arm-ball, which snakes in with the angle and raps Cremer on the pad in line with middle and off. The forefinger goes up..
Maiden five-wicket haul in ODIs for Shakib. Tossed up full, Panyangara wants to swipe across the line but misses as Shakib rattles the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: Two wickets in two overs for Bangladesh. Wide line outside off, Jongwe ill-advisedly chases it with a cut and nicks off with Mushfiq snapping a low catch and the drink would taste doubly sweet for the hosts

belated appeal for caught behind and given! 200th ODI wicket for Mashrafe. Zimbabwe have lost half their side and Mutumbami is nursing an injured ankle. Raza uses his feet, Mashrafe is wary of it as he shortens his length. The batsman swings and edges it behind
short and wide outside off, Waller goes for a cut and ends up spooning it into the lap of Nasir at backward point. Mashrafe has his second scalp

Nasir has his hands aloft in joy; Bangladesh open the series with a crushing win. Chigumbura is the last man out. Mutumbami out with an injured ankle and will not come out to bat. Flattish and pushed through to ping the pad in front of middle and leg

Mushfiqur Rahim: 100 off 104 balls (8 x 4, 1 x 6)
